data.title: Update also @startRow and @endRow on `getState`
data.body:
Close #5883 
Close #5667

Thanks to @izuzak for making this issue reproducible for everyone. Great job, seriously! :clap: 

Unfortunately, #5883 is caused by something different than #5667: if you try to checkout `v0.180` (where the issue originally appeared) you'll find out that the reproducing steps provided by @izuzak won't cause any problem. Therefore, I'd like to apologize with every Atom user for this issue (I am truly sorry if this has caused headaches to you :pray:), because this has been caused by our batching strategy. 

When there is only one pane, everything goes smoothly and no error occurs. However, when there's more than one (and with some particular packages enabled), our `TextEditorPresenter` goes out-of-sync, thus causing that annoying `No line exists for row #{row}. Last screen row: #{@model.getLastScreenRow()}` error. This happens because:
- Something change in the underlying buffer
- `getState` gets called before `updateStartRow` and `updateEndRow` (which would be triggered by a change in the buffer)
- `updateLinesState` tries to traverse an obsolete row range

For symmetry with `@updateState`, I opted to simply include `@updateContentDimensions`, `@updateScrollbarDimensions`, `@updateStartRow` and `@updateEndRow` right before performing any change to the actual state in `@getState`. I didn't batch these methods because they are used also by other non-batched operations (see `@updateHighlightState`) and therefore need to be updated every time. On the other hand they are very fast, and it should be quite cheap to call them.

This should solve once for all any issue that arise from the presenter going out-of-sync with the underlying model because of the async nature of the updates. As a result, I believe that the original issue can be closed as well.

Once again, sorry if this has caused problems to you!

/cc: @nathansobo

data.title: Configurable stylesheets through user-variables.less
data.body:
We were having [this discussion](https://discuss.atom.io/t/how-to-allow-users-to-override-my-packages-less-variables/15243/7?u=braver) and jessegrosjean came up with the idea of a `user-variables.less` file.

There have been attempts to set Less variables through config and they have failed for various reasons. While config would be preferable for discovery and ease of use, if it doesn't work perhaps there is a another way.

Users can now overrule styles with their own stylesheet, but that's very limited. It's impossible to change the overall hue of let's say one-dark-ui because those colors are everywhere throughout the stylesheet and the selectors would just be insane. If you can change the variable however, it's just a single number.

The idea would be to have a user-variables.less file in addition to the syntax-variables and the ui-variables. Theme and package authors can choose where to place the import, thereby maintaining control over which variables can be changed by the user. What can be changed can be communicated in the package's readme. This doesn't change the user stylesheet behaviour and would be added in addition to that stylesheet.

So while I think we can agree this is not the ideal solution, the ideal solution being unavailable this could be a brilliant compromise that opens up a lot of options.

data.title: add  implementation for resizable panes, just solve the issue #274
data.body:
### this commit request implement resizable panes and achieve the feature of  #274.

**printscreen**:
![resizepane](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3992532/6550615/8c760832-c666-11e4-8d5e-dcb5ab2f211d.gif)
#### approach

the approach is inserting resizable view (named pane-resize-handle-view) between two panes. when user move the resizable view,  I will change the pane's flexGrow style value by two pane's width or height ratio. for example, if the left pane is  200px and the right pane is 600px, then I will modify flexGrow style to 0.5 and 1.5.
This way is like tree view's resizable view.

data.title: Make Windows shell integration opt-in via Settings
data.body:
Hello all
we're on windows 7 64bits. After installing Atom, basically everywhere I right-click in windows explorer I see a "Open with Atom" item. We tried cleaning those many elements manually from registry, but at the next update of course they're back again.

How can we opt-out from the Winsows shell integration? Possibly at install time and, also, afterwards through some program preferences,

Thanks

data.title: On Ubuntu 64bit, atom's first launch is a 1x1px window.
data.body:
I wanted to try out atom today, but it seemingly won't launch. I installed the 64bit Ubuntu deb, it installed ok, and when I run 'atom' in my terminal, the command returns immediately with no output, and no window starts. Atom is seeminly running:

```
$ ps aux|grep atom
robru    26233  0.0  0.0  16664  1672 pts/2    S    06:07   0:00 /bin/bash /usr/bin/atom
robru    26235  0.8  0.6 1915900 108176 pts/2  Sl   06:07   0:01 /usr/share/atom/atom --executed-from=/media/robru/Vienna/Downloads --pid=26223
robru    26240  0.0  0.2 321084 38456 pts/2    S    06:07   0:00 /usr/share/atom/atom --type=zygote --no-sandbox
robru    26260  0.2  0.6 513336 109568 pts/2   Sl   06:07   0:00 /usr/share/atom/atom --type=gpu-process --channel=26235.0.1420432126 --no-sandbox --supports-dual-gpus=false --gpu-driver-bug-workarounds=1,12,14,39 --disable-accelerated-video-decode --gpu-vendor-id=0x8086 --gpu-device-id=0x0166 --gpu-driver-vendor --gpu-driver-version
robru    26272  2.1  0.8 1070364 137720 pts/2  Sl   06:07   0:02 /usr/share/atom/atom --type=renderer --force-device-scale-factor=1 --js-flags=--harmony --no-sandbox --enable-deferred-image-decoding --lang=en-GB --node-integration=true --subpixel-font-scaling=false --enable-delegated-renderer --enable-impl-side-painting --num-raster-threads=1 --disable-accelerated-video-decode --channel=26235.1.1108578135
robru    26372  2.3  0.8 1069340 135808 pts/2  Sl   06:08   0:02 /usr/share/atom/atom --type=renderer --force-device-scale-factor=1 --js-flags=--harmony --no-sandbox --enable-deferred-image-decoding --lang=en-GB --node-integration=true --subpixel-font-scaling=false --enable-delegated-renderer --enable-impl-side-painting --num-raster-threads=1 --disable-accelerated-video-decode --channel=26235.2.1864596157
robru    26404  0.1  0.3 896024 53596 pts/2    Sl   06:08   0:00 /usr/share/atom/atom --eval require('/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/coffee-cash/lib/coffee-cash.js').setCacheDirectory('/home/robru/.atom/compile-cache/coffee'); require('/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/coffee-cash/lib/coffee-cash.js').register(); require('/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/coffeestack/index.js').setCacheDirectory('/home/robru/.atom/compile-cache/coffee/source-maps'); require('/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/task-bootstrap.js');
```

But there just isn't any visual indication that anything has happened. `atom --help` reported some options, but `atom -n` failed to create a new window. Also the launcher icon that appeared doesn't open any windows either.

Help!

data.title: Transpile all .ts files
data.body:
This is similar to https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/5299 

Provide TypeScript support to ease package development.
# Motivation
- Provides built in support for sourcemaps 
- No longer need to check in `.js` files when creating packages using TypeScript 
# Sample

You can see a sample package here : https://github.com/basarat/atom-typescript-test 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/874898/6544570/f7ff3fc8-c5a9-11e4-86ed-964df59ee80b.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/874898/6544572/0a1edda8-c5aa-11e4-92cd-d32043e1f958.png)

same as other PR 

``` js
global.require('../src/typescript/').getCacheHits()
global.require('../src/typescript/').getCacheMisses()
```
## TODO:
- [x] Add transpiling support
- [x] Add tests

/cc @vvakame @csnover

data.title: Implementing download accelerator into update functionality of Atom
data.body:
Hi,

I'm just wonder anyway to implement a multi-threading download accelerator alike wget into update functionality of Atom editor. This will make the update process take less time to download rather than traditional update. Whenever I update Atom, I feel like it never complete.

Conclusion: A functionality that allows Atom to update itself including major and plugins with:
1. secure https download accelerator + 
2. integrity check (md5, sha512 hash).

How do you think about this?
Thanks for consideration.

data.body: closes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5888

data.title: Update clean.cmd
data.body: Clean code.

data.title: Initial non-English character is multiplied inside automatically closed quotes
data.body:
I can't explain this behaviour in words only, so here's the gif:

![weird](http://i.imgur.com/QiaT2vL.gif)

On line 2, I'm typing a single Russian letter 'я', but it gets displayed many times in the string. If I press Backspace after that, the whole string of я's is erased.

Whatever I'm typing after the first letter is added to the end of the line after all the repetitions. I can delete the first letter, but then the next letter gets repeated etc. 

The only way to get rid of this is to break the line, but as soon as the closing quote is on the same line, weird behaviour reoccurs.

I've tried Japanese and Kazakh characters as well, with the same result.

My OS is Crunchbang Waldorf. I don't experience this issue in Atom for Windows.

data.title: autoIndentOnPaste should allow pasting white space
data.body:
I enjoy the autoIndentOnPaste feature but when I'm working on a markdown file I sometimes want to paste whitespace.

It would be nice if this feature would exclude any "pastes" that contain only whitespace.

data.title: Windows build readme need update
data.body:
From : https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/windows.md#common-errors I did not get the error : `error MSB8020: The build tools for Visual Studio 2010 (Platform Toolset = 'v100') cannot be found`, but getting past `Installing build modules` was done by the solution recommended for it `$env:GYP_MSVS_VERSION=2013`.

I also needed to run `npm install -g node-gyp` before `gypgypgyp` started showing.

The error I got was: 

```
C:\atom [master +0 ~1 -0]> script/build
Node: v0.10.26
npm: v2.5.1
Python: v2.7.9
Installing build modules...
gypgypgypnpm ERR! Windows_NT 6.2.9200
npm ERR! argv "node" "C:\\atom\\build\\node_modules\\npm\\bin\\npm-cli.js" "--userconfig=C:\\atom\\.npmrc" "install" "--
loglevel" "error"
npm ERR! node v0.10.26
npm ERR! npm  v2.5.1
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE

npm ERR! minidump@0.8.0 install: `node-gyp rebuild`
npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR!
npm ERR! Failed at the minidump@0.8.0 install script 'node-gyp rebuild'.
npm ERR! This is most likely a problem with the minidump package,
npm ERR! not with npm itself.
npm ERR! Tell the author that this fails on your system:
npm ERR!     node-gyp rebuild
npm ERR! You can get their info via:
npm ERR!     npm owner ls minidump
npm ERR! There is likely additional logging output above.
```

Either the build script needs to output the source of the error OR we need to update the readme. Either way wanted to create this issue for tracking / google results.

Currently I am seem to be stuck (5 minutes) at `installing apm`. Lets see how long that goes. 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/874898/6539329/824a6ae4-c4c5-11e4-85ce-d2875d233f64.png)

data.title: Backslashes disappear from "find in project"
data.body:
To reproduce:
1. Shift+command+f to bring up the 'find in project" pane
2. Ensure the regex option is selected
3. Search for a regex that includes a backslash (e.g. `console\.log`)
4. Click any result to go to the file in which it appears
5. Press shift+command+f again.

The backslash has disappeared from the input field. It now says `console.log`.

This has been present in atom for me for months, as long as I can remember. I just reproduced this with `--safe`.

Mac OSX, Atom 0.186.0

data.title: Windows 0.186.0 update: "Failed to spawn command atom\app-0.186.0\resources\app\apm\bin\node"
data.body:
After atom updated to 0.186, when launching atom and at random intervals, I get multiple instances of the message

```
"Failed to spawn command ~\AppData\Local\atom\app-0.186.0\resources\app\apm\bin\node. Make sure ~\AppData\Local\atom\app-0.186.0\resources\app\apm\bin\node is installed and on your PATH"
```

Atom will also crash on shutdown during this time.

At first I had reinstalled from an earlier installation executable (0.17x) to work around the issue, but it came back after the reinstalled version went through its auto update cycle.

The SquirrelSetup.log file shows no trouble in downloading the updates.  However, it has a somewhat contradictory error on installing:

System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception (0x80004005): The operation completed successfully


data.title: Join lines into one long line cases Atom slow or hangs
data.body:
Type `cmd+j` short-cut to join multiple lines into one line, and as the line gets longer, Atom will become slower, even hangs.

This happens on highlight-switch on, while I changed the file type to `txt` and repeated the same steps, Atom seems work much better. The test file is [here](https://gist.github.com/hokein/48a9ed680d69fbf25305).

This may also related to #979.

I'm experiencing this error when executing AtomSetup.exe on Win 8.1 x64.

Before executing, I uninstalled my previous version of atom (182.0), deleted /AppData/Local/atom as well as /Users/<name>/.atom and cleaned the atom registries.

 Anyone know what could be the issue?

data.title: “Restart and install updates” silently fails and does nothing
data.body:
On my Mac (10.9.5), my Atom app notices when there's an update, and indicates it by adding a "Restart and install updates" option in the "Atom" menu. If I choose that menu option, Atom quits, and relaunches, but it's the same version it was; no update seems to have happened.

Looking in the Console log, it seems "ShipIt" is running into issues trying to install Atom, since it can't copy the application to the proper folder:

```
3/5/15 9:25:53.041 AM ShipIt[54372]: Couldn't abort install and restore owned bundle to previous location file:///Applications/Atom.app, error NSError { domain: NSPOSIXErrorDomain, code: 2, description: "No such file or directory" }

3/5/15 9:26:19.075 AM ShipIt[54372]: Installation error: Error Domain=NSPOSIXErrorDomain Code=13 "Permission denied" UserInfo=0x7ff3e3bde200 {NSLocalizedDescription=Permission denied}
```

Atom.app is in the Applications folder, but my user is not an Admin of the computer, so doesn't have permission to copy a file into the Applications folder. Atom should probably pop up an authentication prompt to accomplish that task? Or more gracefully fail out with a dialog to the user indicating there was an error?

data.title: Idea
data.body:
Option to set how many tabs are open at once.

I don't know about you guys, but my tabs very quickly get filled, and are thus rendered useless.

I think it would be great to have an option to set only have two tabs open or 3, so you can switch back and forth quickly to those tabs without having to think about which tab you were last on and where it is.

90% of the time, I just want to use the last tab I had open, and I really cannot use the tabs at all, because there's so many, and I can't tell the names on them. If it automatically closed the 6th to the last tab you had open or so, you could only have the last 5 tabs you had open.

data.title: Upgrade to atom-shell v0.21.3
Searching for new plugins issues
data.body:
There are three issues (should I make 2-3 issues?) with searching for packages/themes to install from the settings menu.

1) Entering in a name and pressing pressing enter does not result in an automatic search for what was typed. It only begins searching when I switch it from packages to themes and back.

2) Whenever I make a new search before the results from the old search are completed, under the search bar says searching for it failed and _getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND_.

3) Sometimes when I search for packages that exist like _quippet_, it says the same thing as above.

**Atom Version**: 0.186.0
**System**: linux 3.13.0-37-generic
**OS**: Linux Mint 17.1 Cinnamon 64-bit

data.title: OpenSuse needs nodejs-devel
data.body:
Hi

I've tried to install from source and using just the nodejs lib I couldn't. Was necessary to install nodejs-devel to get it working (and the other libs described in the link, of course).

Install steps: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/linux.md

Is this package missing in the steps?

System: OpenSuse 13.2 32 bits

Any chance of having a x86 rpm package for it?

Closes #770.
